newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee pulls back futher, May nears $1,600.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee pulls back futher, May nears $1,600.

text.p: Origin offers knocked LIFFE robusta coffee futures to close broadly lower on Tuesday in generally quiet post-Easter holiday trade.
"There has been a re-emergence of origin sellers as the market came back after a four-week weekend," said one trader.

Prices started much higher as expected but producer selling soon emerged to pare most of the gains by lunchtime. In the afernoon, a fresh wave of origin selling, particularly from Africa, then pushed values into the minus column.
By the close, new spot month May, London's benchmark, stood $23 lower at $1,612 a tonne, the session's low and near the closely-watched $1,600 level. Its intraday high was $1,660.
Easier New York market also dented sentiment. But the day's volume of 3,359 lots was rather modest as some players were still away for an extended Easter break.
The London market was closed on Friday and Monday.
There were no fresh fundamental inputs.

U.S. trader Merrill Lynch said in its latest bi-weekly market commentary published on March 27 that the coffee market seemed poised to resume the uptrend on renewed concerns about a tight physical market.
